001package imagingbook.pub.regions;
002
003import java.awt.Rectangle;
004import java.util.HashMap;
005import java.util.List;
006import java.util.Map;
007
008import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
009import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
010import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
011import imagingbook.pub.regions.segment.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a connected component or binary region. 
015 * It is implemented as a non-static inner class to {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation}
016 * because it references common region labeling data.
017 * A {@link BinaryRegion} instance does not have its own list or array of 
018 * contained pixel coordinates but refers to the label array of the
019 * enclosing {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} instance.
020 * Instances of this class support iteration over the contained pixel
021 * coordinates of type {@link Pnt2d}, e.g., by
022 * <pre>
023 * import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
024 * 
025 * BinaryRegion R = ...;
026 * for (Point p : R) {
027 *    // process point p ...
028 * }</pre>
029 * The advantage of providing iteration only is that it avoids the
030 * creation of (possibly large) arrays of pixel coordinates.
031 */
032public abstract class BinaryRegion implements Comparable<BinaryRegion>, Iterable<Pnt2d> {
033
034        /**
035         * Returns the sum of the x-coordinates of the points
036         * contained in this region.
037         * @return the sum of x-values.
038         */
039        public abstract long getX1Sum();
040
041        /**
042         * Returns the sum of the y-coordinates of the points
043         * contained in this region.
044         * @return the sum of y-values.
045         */
046        public abstract long getY1Sum();
047
048        /**
049         * Returns the sum of the squared x-coordinates of the points
050         * contained in this region.
051         * @return the sum of squared x-values.
052         */
053        public abstract long getX2Sum();
054
055        /**
056         * Returns the sum of the squared y-coordinates of the points
057         * contained in this region.
058         * @return the sum of squared y-values.
059         */
060        public abstract long getY2Sum();
061
062        /**
063         * Returns the sum of the mixed x*y-coordinates of the points
064         * contained in this region.
065         * @return the sum of xy-values.
066         */
067        public abstract long getXYSum();
068
069        /**
070         * Calculates and returns a vector of (unnormalized) central moments:
071         * (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11).
072         * @return vector of central moments
073         */
074        public double[] getCentralMoments() {
075                final int n = this.getSize();
076                if (n == 0) {
077                        throw new IllegalStateException("empty region, moments are undefined");
078                }
079                double mu20 = getX2Sum() - getX1Sum() * getX1Sum() / (double) n;
080                double mu02 = getY2Sum() - getY1Sum() * getY1Sum() / (double) n;
081                double mu11 = getXYSum() - getX1Sum() * getY1Sum() / (double) n;
082                return new double[] {mu20, mu02, mu11};
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * Returns the 2x2 covariance matrix for the pixel coordinates
087         * contained in this region:
088         * <pre>
089         * | &sigma;_20 &sigma;_11 | 
090         * | &sigma;_11 &sigma;_02 | 
091         * </pre>
092         * @return the covariance matrix
093         */
094        public double[][] getCovarianceMatrix() {
095                final int n = this.getSize();
096                double[] mu = getCentralMoments(); // = [mu20, mu02, mu11]
097                double[][] S = {
098                                {mu[0]/n, mu[2]/n},
099                                {mu[2]/n, mu[1]/n}};
100                return S;
101        }
102
103
104        /**
105         * Get the size of this region.
106         * @return the number of region points.
107         */
108        public abstract int getSize();
109
110        /**
111         * Get the x/y axes-parallel bounding box as a rectangle
112         * (including the extremal coordinates).
113         * @return the bounding box rectangle.
114         */
115        public abstract Rectangle getBoundingBox();
116
117
118        /**
119         * Returns the center of this region as a 2D point.
120         * @return the center point of this region.
121         */
122        public Pnt2d getCenter() {
123                final int n = this.getSize();
124                if (n == 0) {
125                        throw new IllegalStateException("empty region, center is undefined");
126                }
127                return PntDouble.from(((double)this.getX1Sum())/n, ((double)this.getY1Sum())/n);
128        }
129
130        public abstract void setOuterContour(Contour.Outer contr);
131
132        /**
133         * Get the (single) outer contour of this region.
134         * Points on an outer contour are arranged in clockwise
135         * order.
136         * @return the outer contour.
137         */
138        public abstract Contour getOuterContour();
139
140        /**
141         * Get all inner contours of this region.
142         * Points on inner contours are arranged in counter-clockwise order.
143         * @return the list of inner contours.
144         */
145        public abstract List<Contour> getInnerContours();       // sort!!!
146
147        // Compare method for sorting by region size (larger regions at front)
148        @Override
149        public int compareTo(BinaryRegion other) {
150//              return other.getSize() - this.getSize();
151                return Integer.compare(other.getSize(), this.getSize());
152        }
153
154        /**
155         * Checks if the given pixel position is contained in this
156         * {@link BinaryRegion} instance.
157         * @param u x-coordinate
158         * @param v y-coordinate
159         * @return true if (u,v) is contained in this region
160         */
161        public abstract boolean contains(int u, int v);
162
163        // ------------------------------------------------------------
164        // ------------------------------------------------------------
165
166
167        /* Methods for attaching region properties dynamically.
168         * Properties can be used to hash results of region calculations
169         * to avoid multiple calculations.
170         * Currently, only 'double' values are supported.
171         * 
172         * E.g. calculate major axis angle theta for region r, then do
173         *    r.setProperty("angle", theta);
174         * and subsequently
175         *    double theta = r.getProperty("angle");
176         */
177
178        private Map<Object, Double> properties = null;
179
180        /**
181         * Sets the specified property of this region to the given value.
182         * @param key The key of the property.
183         * @param val The value associated with this property.
184         */
185        public void setProperty(Object key, double val) {
186                if (key == null) {
187                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("property key must not be null");
188                }
189                if (properties == null) {
190                        properties = new HashMap<>();
191                }
192                properties.put(key, val);
193        }
194
195        /**
196         * Retrieves the specified region property. 
197         * {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown if the property 
198         * is not defined for this region.
199         * 
200         * @param key The key of the property.
201         * @return The value associated with the specified property.
202         */
203        public double getProperty(Object key) {
204                if (key == null) {
205                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("property key must not be null");
206                }
207                Double value;
208                if (properties == null || (value = properties.get(key)) == null) {
209                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Region property " + key + " is undefined.");
210                }
211                return value.doubleValue();
212        }
213
214        /**
215         * Removes all properties attached to this region.
216         */
217        public void clearProperties() {
218                properties.clear();
219        }
220        
221
222}
